questions.questiontext: Which of the following is used to ensure integrity?
If an individual is involved in an ethical dilemma where there is conflict between the (ISC)2 canons, how should the conflict be resolved?
questions.answerchoice1: It is not possible to have a conflict between the cannons
questions.answerchoice3: The (ISC)2 peer review panel should queried
questions.answerchoice4: Conflicts between the canons should be resolved in the order of the cannons

questions.questiontext: Members who violate any provision of the (ISC)2 Code of Ethics may be subject to revocation of certification. Who makes this determination?
questions.answerchoice2: The (ISC)2 Code of Ethics review board

questions.questiontext: What are the three main goals of any information security program?
questions.answerchoice1: Preventing losses in accounting, integrity, and confidentiality
questions.answerchoice2: Preventing losses in availability, identification, and confidentiality
questions.answerchoice3: Preventing losses in availability, integrity, and due care
questions.answerchoice4: Preventing losses in availability, integrity, and confidentiality

questions.questiontext: Which of the following describes preventing the loss of confidentiality?
questions.answerchoice1: Protecting disclosure of data from unauthorized users
questions.answerchoice2: Protecting disclosure of data from authorized users
questions.answerchoice3: Ensuring that the data hasn't been modified
questions.answerchoice4: Ensuring that users can access the data when it's needed

questions.questiontext: Which of the following provides a layered approach to security?
You want to ensure that a system can identify individual users, track their activity, and log their actions. What does this provide?
What are the three A's (AAA) of information security?
You want to ensure that users sending email are not able to deny sending it. What is this called?
Which of the following is used to validate an e-commerce transaction?
An organization grants users access only to system resources that they need to perform their job. What principle is this?
Which of the following is a security principle designed to prevent fraud by ensuring that job responsibilities are divided?
An organization has a responsibility to investigate risks associated with new purchases.  What is this?

questions.answerchoice1: Implementing security policies and procedures to protect resources
questions.answerchoice3: Don't need due care over PII
questions.answerchoice4: Organizations can be sued if they fail to exercise due care over resources such as customer data
